parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of Hebrew origin; my master, i.e Rabbi, as an official title of honor.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A begetter, father; plur: parents. From the base of ginomai; a parent.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.
